text: The Belen Harvey House, at 104 N. 1st St. in Belen, New Mexico, was built in 1901 as the Santa Fe Hotel. It was extensively remodeled in 1910 into a Harvey House, one of a number of restaurants at railway stations in the U.S. southwest. The architect for the remodel was Myron Church and the architectural style is Mission/Spanish Revival. The building is currently used as a museum. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1983. title: Belen Harvey House
